intro: Peucedanum dasycarpum, commonly known as the hairy-fruited parsley. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant is native to Central Asia and thrives in temperate climates. Its fruits are small, dry, and covered in fine hairs, giving it its common name. It is often cultivated for its aromatic foliage and potential medicinal properties.
